intro: Sinojackia rehderiana, commonly known as the Chinese sandthorn, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and thorny stems. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Sinojackia rehderiana is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
